Articles.Content: hey Im going to start a youtube account and i am curious to see if any of you guys have any suggestions for the recording software

Open broadcaster software works great. Though mainly optimized for streaming, it can record to your hard drive. If you have $20-30 USD to spare, you can get Fraps, which is one of the better and more popular choices.
bandicam is good. FRAPS used to work for me, but all of a sudden it crashed KSP.

I've used FRAPS for a long time without any hassles. I think that it's the good choice.

Audials Moviebox is one of the Windows applications which are able to record and convert video streams from Youtube and other similar online streaming video platforms.

http://audials.com/en/how_to_record_stream_capture_music_videos_movies_from/youtube.html
If you use a Mac, the App store has a ton of capture utilities, some free and some not. Not sure if QT does it but I've used Snapz X Pro for years with good results.
If windows use dxtory cost money but very good in performance when recording.
